This is a placeholder for Header clauses, if any.

Background
Context

[Name] has applied under [name and citation of statute].

[Name of other party] has been served;

Upon hearing [describe whether parties, parties’ counsel, one party and the other’s counsel];

Having considered the evidence and submissions;

Optional Provisos

The parties are [not] married.

Children

The parties are the parents of the following child[ren] who are referred to as 'the child[ren]' in this order:

"[name] admits he is [the father/a possible father] of:

Child NameDate of Birth
[Name][Date]

[Name] reserves his right to challenge paternity in the future.

Leave

"[Name of party seeking leave], [describe connection of party seeking leave to the child(ren)], has applied for leave to apply for [custody and/or access] to the child(ren):"

Child NameDate of Birth
[Name][Date]

[Names of other parties] agree [name of party seeking leave] will have leave to apply for [custody and/or access];

Decision Making
Day to Day Decisions

The party caring for the child(ren) will make decisions related to the child(ren)'s daily care while the child(ren) is/are in their care.

Shared Decision Making

"Each party will meaningfully consult with the other on all major health, education and religion decisions respecting the child(ren).

If the parties cannot agree, they will seek a mediator's assistance to reach an agreement. The cost of mediation will be: [shared equally/paid in proportion to each party's gross annual income].

If the parties cannot agree, they will follow the advice of a professional who provides care to the child(ren).

If the parties cannot agree, [Name] will make the final decision.

Sole Decision Making

[Name] will make all major health, education and religion decisions respecting the child(ren).

[Name] will make decisions about the child(ren)'s daily care.

[Name] will consult with [name of other party] before making any non-emergency decisions in the child(ren)'s life. The consultation shall occur as soon as [name] becomes aware of an issue requiring decision and, if possible, at least 30 days before the date when a decision must be made. [Name of other party] can make inquiries, provide feedback and suggestions. After consulting, [name] will make the decision.

[Name] can choose a daycare or pre-school program, and pre- and after-school care for the child(ren).

[Name] can enroll the child(ren) in French Immersion.

[Name] can choose any professionals or service providers for the child(ren), including the doctor, dentist, counsellor, tutors, etc. [Name] has the authority to determine the need for professional involvement. Except for emergency medical treatment, [name of other party] cannot take the child(ren) to any health care provider or counsellor, without [name]'s prior consent.

Emergency Medical Decisions

In an emergency, each party can authorize the child(ren)'s emergency medical care.

In an emergency, the party solely authorizing emergency medical care must notify the other party as soon as it is practical to do so, considering the nature of the emergency.

Information Access

Each party is can make inquiries and receive information from the child(ren)'s educators, counselors, care-givers, healthcare providers and religious leaders.

Each party can receive the child(ren)'s school report cards, medical reports, dental reports, specialist reports, and information regarding the child(ren)'s recreational activities.

[Name] will keep [name of other party] informed about the institutions and individuals involved with the child(ren). Institutions include schools, hospitals, churches, care programs, and recreational associations. Individuals include teachers, school staff, day care and child care staff, doctors, dentists, medical specialists, counselors, therapists, coaches, and trainers. Information will be in writing. Information will include the name, address and contact details (telephone, fax, email, and website).

If contacts are required for the child(ren), both parties will be listed as contacts.

[Name] will notify [name of other party] in writing about all the child(ren)'s medical and professional appointments as soon as they are booked and provide full particulars immediately after the appointment.

Both parties can speak directly with the child(ren)'s teachers, caregivers, physicians, dentists, and other healthcare providers about the child(ren).

This order is each party's consent and authorization to all persons, including teachers, doctors, dentists and others involved with the child(ren), to speak fully and openly with both parties.

Each party must immediately notify the other if the child(ren) has/have a serious illness or accident while in his or her care.

Attendance

Both parties may attend the child(ren)'s appointments.

Both parties may attend the child(ren)'s activities, such as concerts, recitals, games, practices, medical and dental.

Both parties may attend the child(ren)’s functions, such as their birthday parties.

Both parties may attend meetings relating to the child(ren), such as parent-teacher meetings.

Custody Upon a Party's Death

Each party will make and maintain a valid Will providing the other party will be guardian of the child(ren)’s property on his or her death.

Communication
Communication Guidelines for the Parties

Neither party will speak negatively to, or about, the other party or permit others to do so in the child(ren)’s presence.

Neither party will allow any person to make negative or disparaging comments to the child(ren) about the other party or members of their family or household.

At all times, the parties will encourage the child(ren) to have a positive and respectful relationship with the other party and members of the other party’s family and household.

Neither party will discuss adult matters with the child(ren) or in their presence.

The parties will not communicate about issues or non-emergency arrangements when the child(ren) is/are present or nearby.

The parties will not involve the child(ren) in conveying messages or documents between them.

The parties will not question the child(ren) or comment to the child(ren) about the other party.

The parties will communicate civilly and will only discuss the child(ren).

The parties will communicate mainly by email. For time-sensitive matters, they will call or text and a response will be provided as soon as the party receives the communication.

Each party will check their email at least once daily.

Each party will respond to email inquiries within 24 hours of receipt (except during vacations).

Email communications will be brief, civil and focused on parenting.

The child(ren) will not be shown emails and written communications between the parties.

Communication With the Children

Each party can communicate with the child(ren) at any time by any means.

Each party can communicate with the child(ren) at reasonable times by telephone, Facetime, Skype, or other means.

Each party can communicate with the child(ren) by telephone, Facetime, Skype or other means at the following times: [specify times].

Each party can communicate with the child(ren) by telephone, Facetime, Skype or other means on the following terms: [specify terms - times and conditions].

Unless there is an emergency, neither party will communicate with the child(ren) when the child(ren) [is/are] in the other party’s care.

Higher Conflict Situations

The parties will share relevant information in a bound journal. Relevant information is information about everyday issues that affect the child(ren)’s care and upbringing. Journal entries are to be in pen and dated. Neither party may change or delete any journal entry. Journal entries must be child-focused.

Unless there is an emergency, the parties communication must be in writing (e-mail or text).

Unless there is an emergency, the parties will communicate through a software program, such as Our Family Wizard.

If there is an emergency, the parties can communicate by telephone.

Communication Through Third Parties

The parties will communicate through [name of third party] or another person agreed upon between them in advance.

Travel
Itinerary

When a party proposes to travel with the child(ren), he or she will provide an itinerary to the other party a minimum of [number] days before the proposed travel.

The itinerary will contain the dates of travel, the destination, the address at the destination where the child(ren) will be staying, and a telephone number where the child can be reached.

Travel Inside Nova Scotia

The child(ren) can travel within Nova Scotia when it does not interfere with their scheduled time with the other party.

Travel Outside Nova Scotia and Within Canada

The child(ren) can only travel outside Nova Scotia and within Canada with the written consent of the other party.

International Travel

Each party will provide the other with no less than [number] days’ notice of any proposal to travel with the child(ren) outside Canada, along with a proposed itinerary.

A party may not unreasonably withhold consent for the child(ren) to travel outside Canada, if proposed travel is in the child(ren)’s best interests.

Both parties will cooperate in signing documents for the child(ren)’s international travel (i.e., passport applications, passport renewal applications, travel consent letters).

Both parties will facilitate the child(ren)’s international travel by providing the child(ren)’s passport(s) at least [number] days before the departure date.

Passports

Both parties will cooperate in obtaining and renewing the child(ren)’s passport(s).

[Name] will store the child(ren)’s passport(s) until they are needed for travel.

Parenting Arrangements
Primary Residence

The child(ren)’s primary residence will be with [name].

Starting [insert date], on a two-week rotating schedule as follows:

  • Week One: [day] at [time] to [day] at [time].
  • Week Two: [day] at [time] to [day] at [time].

The child(ren) will have parenting time with [name] as follows: Every second weekend from [day] at [time] to [day] at [time], starting on [insert start date];

Shared Parenting
Week On Week Off

Starting [insert start date], the child(ren) will spend equal amounts of time in each party’s home, on a week-on, week-off schedule, with exchanges on [day] at [time].

4/3/3/4

The child(ren) will spend equal amounts of time in both parties’ homes, on a 4/3/3/4 schedule, so the child(ren) are with [name] starting on [date] for four overnights; with [name of other party] for the next three overnights; with [name] for the next three overnights; and with [name of other party] for the next four overnights and so on. Exchanges will occur at [time].

Other Shared Parenting Schedule

The parties will spend parenting time with the child(ren) as follows: The child(ren) will be with [name] from [day] at [time] to [day] at [time] and with [name of other party] from [day] at [time] to [day] at [time].

Supervised Parenting Time
Third Party Supervisor

"[Name]’s parenting time with the child(ren) will be supervised. Supervisors may be [names] and any other person the parties agree upon; Supervised parenting time will be: [day(s)] at [time(s)] to [day(s)] at [time(s)]. "

Supervised parenting time will occur as agreed between the parties and the supervisor.

Veith House

[Name]’s parenting time with the child(ren) will occur through Veith House’s supervised access program.

The first three visits will be no more than one hour long and the other visits will be for the maximum amount allowed by Veith House’s supervised access program.

Visits will be at least [weekly/bi-weekly/bi-monthly/monthly].

Visits will start no earlier than [date].

This order for supervised access through Veith House’s supervised access program may be renewed after 12 visits.

Either party may ask to renew this order for supervised access through Veith House’s supervised access program.

The parties will return to court for a conference on [date].

Supervised Exchange Program

The parties will use Veith House’s supervised access exchange program. [Specify details].

Contact Time

[Name of non-parent/non-guardian party] will have contact time with the child(ren), as follows: [specify].

[Name of non-parent/non-guardian party]’s contact time is subject to these conditions: [specify].

Interaction

[Name] will have interaction with the child(ren). [Name] may:

  • attend specified activities;
  • send gifts to the child(ren);
  • receive gifts from the child(ren);
  • communicate with the child(ren) by telephone, Skype, or Facetime;
  • communicate with the child(ren) by cards, letters, or email; and
  • receive photographs of the child(ren) and information about the children’s health, education, and well-being from a designated source.
Transportation
Transportation Provided by Parties

[Name] will transport the child(ren) to and from [specify location].

Each party will pick up the child(ren) from [specify location] at the beginning of his or her parenting time.

The parties will meet at an agreed-upon neutral location [or specify location] to exchange the child(ren).

Third Party Transport

The parties will agree on a person to transport the child(ren).

[Name] may not transport the children.

General Clauses
Contact Information

Each party will inform the other of all changes to his or her: home address, home phone number, work address, work phone number, or any other means of contact such as cell phone numbers, fax numbers, or email addresses.

Scheduling Activities

Neither party will schedule child(ren)'s activities during the other's time with the child(ren), unless the other party agrees.

Neither party will unreasonably withhold their consent to scheduling an activity for the child(ren).

Where the parties have agreed to an activity, each party is responsible for transporting the child(ren) to the activity during his or her parenting time.

The parties shall share selection of the child(ren)'s extracurricular activities as follows: Each year they will take turns selecting activities.

In even-numbered years, [name] will select first, and make a selection by January 31. [Name of other party] will select second by March 31. [Name] will select third by May 31. [Name of other party] will select fourth by July 31. If a party misses a deadline for selection, the other party may proceed with his or her selection. In odd-numbered years, the pattern is reversed.

Unless the parties agree otherwise, neither party shall be entitled to select more than two activities for the child(ren) annually.

Selections may be for an activity that occurs during any part of the year. A selection may not overlap or conflict with the schedule for a previously selected activity.

Only the party who has physical care of the child(ren) during the activity may attend the activity. Both parties may attend school events, religious events, play offs, final competitions and presentations.

The party who has physical care of the child(ren) is responsible for preparing the child(ren) for the activity.

Each party will use best efforts to ensure the child(ren) attend(s) most activity commitments during the time the child(ren) are with him/her.

If a party has difficulty arranging transportation to an activity but does not otherwise have plans involving the child(ren), the other party will be asked to transport the child(ren) to the activity.

Right of First Refusal

During work hours when one party is working and the other is not, the party who is not working may have time with the child(ren).

Outside of work hours if [Name] is not available to care for the child(ren) for more than [number] hours, [Name of other party] may have time with the child(ren).

Grandparents: This clause does not apply to reasonable time the child(ren) may spend with their grandparents.

Conditions and Restrictions
Safety

The parties will follow all provincial laws for the child(ren)'s use of motor vehicles, including ATVs and 4-wheelers.

The parties will follow all provincial laws about car seats.

Alcohol and Drugs

Neither party will consume any alcohol, non-prescription drugs or marijuana, during their parenting time.

Neither party will consume alcohol, non-prescription drugs or marijuana, for [number] hours before their parenting time.

Neither party will consume alcohol or marijuana to excess during their parenting time.

Each party will use prescribed medications as required for [number] of hours before and during their parenting time.

Corporal Punishment

Physical discipline will not be used on the child(ren).

Grandparent Clauses
Custody

[Grandparent(s)' name(s)] has/have leave to apply for [custody/access/interaction/contact time] with [child(ren)'s name(s)].

[Grandparent(s)' name(s)] will have joint custody of [child(ren)'s name(s)] with [name(s) of other parties with custodial rights].

Contact Time

[Grandparent(s)' name(s)] will have contact time with the child(ren) at the following times [and subject to the following conditions]: [dates, times and conditions, if any, of contact time].

Interaction

[Grandparent(s)' name(s)], will have interaction with the child(ren).

  • attend specified activities;
  • send gifts to the child(ren);
  • receive gifts from the child(ren);
  • communicate with the child(ren) by telephone, Skype, or Facetime;
  • communicate with the child(ren) by cards, letters, or email;
  • receive photographs of the child(ren) and information about the children’s health, education, and well-being from a designated source.
Child Support
Income
Court Determined Income

[Name]'s annual income is $[amount] for the purpose of determining child support.

Income Below Tables

[Name]'s annual income is less than the lowest income that requires support to be paid on the Nova Scotia Tables of the Child Support Guidelines.

Agreed Upon Income

[Name]'s annual income is agreed by the parties to be $ [amount], without the court's determination.

Average Income

[Name]'s an annual income is $[amount], calculated as an average of his/her employment income earned from [employment name] for [list years].

[Name]'s annual income is $[amount], determined by the court based on the pattern of annual income for [list years].

Self-Employment

[Name]'s annual income is $[amount], based on the parties' agreement that, on average, [name] earns this amount from self-employment.

Imputing Income

[Name]'s annual income is $[amount]. This amount is imputed under clause [19(1)[insert clause] of the Child Maintenance Guidelines / Federal Child Support Guidelines.

Table Child Support
Table - Paid Every Two Weeks

[Payor] will pay child support of $[amount] each month to [recipient] under the Nova Scotia Child Maintenance Guidelines / Federal Child Support Guidelines and in accordance with the Nova Scotia table, starting [date]. Payments of $[amount] will be made every two weeks.

Rounding Up / Excess of Table Amount

[Payor] will pay monthly child support of $[amount] to [recipient] under the [Nova Scotia Child Maintenance Guidelines / Federal Child Support Guidelines] based on an annual income in excess of $150,000.00, starting [date].

Reasonable Arrangements

Under subsection 15.1(7) of the Divorce Act [if an originating child support application], having regard to the applicable Guidelines, [Name]'s payment of these expenses constitutes reasonable arrangements for the child(ren)'s support and [Name] will pay an amount of child support that is different from the amount determined in accordance with the applicable Guidelines.

Under subsection 15.1(7) of the Parenting and Support Act and with the parties' consent, having regard to the applicable Guidelines, [Name]'s payment of these expenses constitutes reasonable arrangements for the child(ren)'s support and [Name] will pay an amount of child support that is different from the amount determined in accordance with the applicable Guidelines.

Shared Custody Set Off

Taking into account the amounts set out in the applicable tables for each of the parties, the increased costs of shared custody arrangements and the condition, means needs and other circumstances of each party and of the child(ren) for whom support is sought, [payor] will pay monthly child support of $[amount] starting [date], based on the amounts set out in the applicable tables for each of the parties.

Child Support Arrears

[Payor] owes [recipient] arrears of child support of $[amount], calculated as follows:

YearIncomeTable amountPaidArrears
[year][amount][amount][amount][amount]
[year][amount][amount][amount][amount]

[Payor] will pay child support arrears to [recipient] of $ [amount] each month. Payments are due on [date] each month, starting [date] for [number] months until [date].

Retroactive Child Support

[Payor] owes [recipient] retroactive child support of $[amount], calculated as follows:

YearIncomeTable amountPaidArrears
[year][amount][amount][amount][amount]
[year][amount][amount][amount][amount]

[Payor] will pay retroactive child support to [recipient] of $[amount] each month. Payments are due on [date] each month, starting [date] for [number] months until [date].

Special or Extraordinary Expenses

"[Payor] will pay monthly child support of $[amount] to [recipient] as a contribution to the following special / extraordinary expense: [Child(ren)'s name(s)], Description of Expense: [description] Total monthly net expense: $ [amount] Monthly amount to be paid: $ [amount] Percentage: % [percentage]"

Undue Hardship

[Payor] lives in Nova Scotia.

[name of person] shares household expenses with [payor] and has an annual income of $ [amount].

[Recipient] lives in Nova Scotia.

[name of person] shares household expenses with [recipient] and has an annual income of $ [amount].

Support for Children Over the Age of Majority
Children Over the Age of Majority

[Name] is over the age of majority and is a child for the purpose of child support because [he/she] is a student enrolled full-time in a post-secondary institution. The court may require a child to make a contribution to the expenses of their post-secondary education.

Termination of Child Support

Child support payments will end when the child completes their first post-secondary degree, a diploma or a certified trade, or ceases to be enrolled in full-time studies, whichever is earlier. The parties agree child support will terminate when the child attains the age of majority, graduates from high school, or ceases to be a student, whichever is earlier.

Future Child Support/Support for a Child Over the Age of Majority

The parties will share the costs of the child’s post-secondary education in proportion to their incomes. The parties will contribute to the child’s living expenses while at school in proportion to their incomes. A new child support order will be made when the child is accepted to post-secondary education. The order will reflect the child’s and parties’ financial situations at that time. Payments will be made directly to the child. The parties will exchange financial disclosure before the child starts post-secondary education. The financial disclosure will include tax returns for the past three years.

Payment of Child Support Directly to Child Over the Age of Majority

[Payor] will pay child support payments directly to the child.

Disclosure

The parties will provide each other, by July 1 of each year, with their current addresses, employment information, and a complete copy of their income tax returns and Notices of Assessment for the previous year. If a party is not an employee, the party will provide their current addresses, employment information, and a complete copy of their income tax returns and Notices of Assessment for the past three years. This information will include all schedules and attachments.

Administrative Recalculation of Child Support
General

Either party may apply for recalculation of child support with the Administrative Recalculation Service.

Review and Recalculation

The amount of child support will be reviewed and recalculated annually by the Administrative Recalculation Service.

Recalculation Restrictions

The parties will not apply for recalculation of child support within the first year of this order.

Right of Object to Recalculated Amount

Any party who objects to a recalculated amount of child support will have 30 days to file a motion to vary with the court to have the amount determined judicially.

Notice to Recalculation Clerk

The parties must provide to the Director of Maintenance Enforcement and the Administrative Recalculation Service clerk written notice of any of the following events:

  • a change in a party’s address or contact information;
  • a change in the child(ren)’s living arrangements, status (full-time or part-time student), or address; and
  • a change in a party’s employment.
Health Insurance

Each party is responsible for maintaining their own health insurance.

[Name] will be responsible for maintaining the child(ren)'s health insurance, including any private medical, dental, or vision plans.

Life Insurance
Life Insurance - Child Support

[Name] will designate the child(ren) as the irrevocable beneficiary of a life insurance policy, in the amount of [amount] until the child support obligation ends.

Life Insurance - Spousal Support

[Name] will designate the other party as the irrevocable beneficiary of a life insurance policy, in the amount of [amount] for so long as the spousal support obligation exists.

Spousal Support
Entitlement

[Name] is entitled to spousal support as [describe basis for entitlement].

No Entitlement

The parties agree that spousal support is not payable. Both parties are able to support themselves and waive any future right to spousal support.

No Ability to Pay

[Name] has a low income and no ability to pay spousal support at this time.

Periodic Payment

[Name of Payor] will pay spousal support to [Name of Recipient] in the amount of $ [amount] per month, starting [date] and continuing on the [day of the month] of each month thereafter.

Spousal Support Review

Spousal support payments will be reviewed on [date] and may be varied, extended, or terminated at that time.

Spousal Support Arrears

[Name of Payor] owes spousal support arrears of $ [amount], to be paid at a rate of $ [amount] per month until paid in full.

Lump Sum Spousal Support

[Name of Payor] will pay a lump sum spousal support payment of $ [amount] to [Name of Recipient] by [date].

End of Spousal Support
End - Conditional

Spousal support will end on the earliest of the following events: [list conditions, e.g., cohabitation, remarriage, death of either party].

End - Date

Spousal support will end on [date] or upon the death of either party, whichever occurs first.

Reimbursement of Tax

Both parties will cooperate to ensure that spousal support payments are deductible to the payor and taxable to the recipient. [Name of Payor] will reimburse [Name of Recipient] for any taxes paid by the recipient as a result of the spousal support payments.

Support Enforcement
Director of Maintenance Enforcement

The parties agree that all support payments under this Order will be made directly between the parties and will not be enforced by the Director of Maintenance Enforcement. This Order will be filed with the Director of Maintenance Enforcement for information purposes only. The Director will not take any enforcement action on this Order without a further order of the court.

Property Division
Matrimonial Assets Division

The parties have a common-law relationship. All property will be divided pursuant to the [Matrimonial Property Act / Marital Property Act / Family Property Act].

Payment

[Name of Payor] will pay a payment of $ [amount] to [Name of Recipient] by [date], as a division of property.

Matrimonial Home / Family Residence
Exclusive Occupation/Use

[Name] will have exclusive use and occupation of the matrimonial home located at [address] and the other party will move out by [date].

Transfer to One Party

[Name] will transfer all of his or her interest in the matrimonial home located at [address] to [name of other party]. This transfer will be completed by [date]. [Name of other party] will be solely responsible for all costs associated with the property from this date forward and will indemnify and save harmless the other party for any such costs or liabilities.

Pensions and CPP
Pension Division

[Name] will pay a lump sum payment to [Name of Recipient] of $ [amount] in consideration of the division of [Name]'s pension. This payment will be made on or before [date].

CPP Assignment

The parties agree that they are not entitled to a division of their Canada Pension Plan credits.

QDRO

This Order will serve as a Qualified Domestic Relations Order (QDRO) for the division of [Name]'s pension with [pension plan name].

Waiver of Pension

[Name] waives any and all rights to the division of [Name of other party]'s pension.

Personal Property
Personal Property Division

The parties have already divided all personal property to their mutual satisfaction and will not make any further claims against each other for the division of personal property.

Vehicles

Each party will be solely responsible for any vehicles in their possession and will indemnify and save harmless the other party for any liabilities associated with said vehicles.

Business Interests

The parties have no business interests to be divided.

Inheritance

Any inheritance received by a party is considered his or her own property and is not subject to division.

Dispute Resolution
Mediation

The parties agree to attempt to resolve any future disputes through mediation before either party commences a court application.

Dispute Resolution Officer

The parties agree to participate in a Dispute Resolution Officer conference to address any outstanding parenting or support issues.

General
Terms

The parties agree to these terms, which are binding and enforceable. These terms are an agreement for the purpose of a court order.

Jurisdiction

The parties agree that the court in [province/state] has jurisdiction to hear any future disputes related to this Order.

Release of Information

The parties agree to release any and all information necessary for the purpose of this Order, including medical, educational, and financial information.

Notices

The parties agree that all notices under this Order will be in writing and delivered to the last known address or email of the other party.
